This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-18T12:16:26Z Megan Karnes 2015-02-18T12:16:29-00:00 2015-02-18T12:16:29-00:00 Re: BSA Alcohol Study Group event: Alcohol Explorations 27 Feb 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP;9913cbf2.1502 Hi all,<br><br>Please remove me from this list.<br><br>Megan<br><br>From: British Sociological Association Alcohol Study Group list<br>[mailto:BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Thomas<br>Thurnell-Read<br>Sent: 18 February 2015 10:53<br>To: BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: BSA Alcohol Study Group event: Alcohol Explorations 27 Feb 2015<br><br>Dear Alcohol Study Group members,<br><br>I am pleased to say that the response to the Alcohol Explorations: A<br>Research Methods Workshop event has been very strong and we now only have<br>three places left before we reach capacity and close registration. Further,<br>the three subsidised places have now been claimed. [...] Thomas Thurnell-Read 2015-02-18T10:52:46+00:00 2015-02-18T10:52:46+00:00 BSA Alcohol Study Group event: Alcohol Explorations 27 Feb 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP;f689b49c.1502 Dear Alcohol Study Group members,<br><br>I am pleased to say that the response to the Alcohol Explorations: A Research Methods Workshop event has been very strong and we now only have three places left before we reach capacity and close registration. Further, the three subsidised places have now been claimed.<br><br>The event will take place at the BSA Meeting Rooms, Imperial Wharf, Fulham, London on Friday February 27th 2015 and, as you will see from the attached poster, involves some great speakers including Prof Shane Blackman of Canterbury Christ Church University, Dr Karenza Moore of Lancaster University and Dr Oliver [...] Teresa Williams 2015-01-16T11:32:13+00:00 2015-01-16T11:32:13+00:00 Fwd: https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP;25e47f89.1501 *European Alcohol Conference*<br><br>*Comparing and contrasting practice across Europe*<br><br>*Venue: The Livery Hall, Guildhall, City of London*<br><br>*Date: 24th April 2015*<br><br>*Website and*<br><br>*Registration: *http://drinkanddrugsnews.com/european-alcohol-conference/<br><br>*Price: \ufffd\ufffd140 + VAT*<br><br>*Presented by: *<br><br>*London Drug and Alcohol Policy Forum*<br><br>*Safe Sociable London Partnership *<br><br>*Drink and Drugs News, *<br><br>*The Blenheim*<br><br>*Public Health England*<br><br>*Federation of Drug and Alcohol Professionals*<br><br>*Adfam*<br><br>*Esprit de Bois*<br><br>*Conference Synopsis*<br><br>Despite the shared science and knowledge on alcohol, there is considerable<br>difference on how policy and public health is interpreted and delivered<br>across Europe [...] Doherty, Laura (l.doherty111@canterbury.ac.uk) 2015-01-15T22:18:41+00:00 2015-01-15T22:18:41+00:00 BSA Alcohol Study Group Members News and Events https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP;e3877715.1501 Dear Alcohol Study Group Members,<br><br>Just a quick email to say that I am intending to start a monthly 'News and Events' type bulletin to be published via the BSA Alcohol Study Group Blog<https://bsaalcoholgroup.wordpress.com/>. The purpose of this is to disseminate activities, events and research is going on amongst our group members, as well as publicising events etc. that would be of interest to our members... [...] Doherty, Laura (l.doherty111@canterbury.ac.uk) 2015-01-08T15:50:07+00:00 2015-01-08T15:50:07+00:00 Fw: Drinking Studies Network: 2015 Conference Call for Papers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP;f547bfb.1501 Dear Alcohol Study Group Members,<br><br>Apologies for any cross-posting.<br><br>Please see Deborah Toner's message below regarding an event which is being organised; which may be of interest to group members.<br><br>Best Wishes,<br><br>Laura<br><br>Laura Doherty<br>BSA Alcohol Study Group Convenor<br>PhD Research Student<br>Canterbury Christ Church University,<br>Department of Media, Art and Design<br>ld111@canterbury.ac.uk Thomas Thurnell-Read 2014-12-18T10:42:22+00:00 2014-12-18T10:42:22+00:00 BSA Alcohol Study Group event: Alcohol Explorations 27 Feb 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP;900373ec.1412 Dear Alcohol Study Group members,<br><br>It is my pleasure to announce our next event. Alcohol Explorations: A Research Methods Workshop will take place at the BSA Meeting Rooms, Imperial Wharf, Fulham, London on Friday February 27th 2015. As you will see from the attached poster, we have an excellent line up of speakers confirmed including: Prof Shane Blackman of Canterbury Christ Church University, Dr Karenza Moore of Lancaster University and Dr Oliver Smith of Plymouth University. Each speaker will address a particular research method and reflect on their experiences of its use in researching alcohol, drinking and drunkenness. [...] Peter Lugosi 2014-11-19T11:52:26+00:00 2014-11-19T11:52:26+00:00 Books Available for Review and New Issue Contents Alert (Hospitality & Society) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP;e792445.1411 Dear Colleagues,<br><br>Apologies for cross posting.<br><br>Below are details of books available for review in Hospitality & Society.<br>It's an eclectic selection, which reflects the diversity of our scope and<br>readership. Also contained are the details of the final issue of 2014,<br>which was published recently. There is also a call for contributions to<br>future issues. [...] Thomas Thurnell-Read 2014-11-14T10:43:10+00:00 2014-11-14T10:43:10+00:00 New Problems, Old Solutions? Historical Trends and Current Directions in Public Policy on Psychoactive Substances https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP;759c1b04.1411 Dear Study Group Members, Please see below details of a very interesting event taking place next month in Leeds. Best wishes, Tom Dr. Thomas Thurnell-Read Senior Lecturer in Sociology and Course Director for Sociology Degrees Department of International Studies and Social Science Faculty of Business, Environment and Society Coventry University, UK Office: GE311 Email: t.thurnell-read@coventry.ac.uk Tel: 02476 888918 (Internal ext. 8918) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Dear all, The programme and further details are now available for the forthcoming event 'New Problems, Old Solutions? Historical Trends and Current Directions in Public Policy on Psychoactive Substances'. The one-day event will feature keynote presentations from Professor [...] Bell, Steven 2014-10-10T09:02:45+00:00 2014-10-10T09:02:45+00:00 JOB: Research Associate in Epidemiology at UCL (alcohol consumption and CVD) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP;5a180a2a.1410 Apologies for any cross-posting. Please forward this message to any colleagues who you feel may be interested in applying. Thanks and best wishes.<br><br>Research Associate in Epidemiology (ref. 1434294)<br>Full Time (3 years, starting January 2015)<br>Research Department of Epidemiology & Public Health, UCL<br><br>Deadline for applications: Friday 24th October 2014 (23:00)<br>Shortlist date: Candidates will be informed by Monday 3rd November 2014<br>Interview date: Week commencing 10th November 2014 [...] Peter Lugosi 2014-07-15T11:01:05+01:00 2014-07-15T11:01:05+01:00 Books available for review https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP;2fe732fd.1407 Dear Colleagues,<br><br>Sincere apologies if you receive this more than once. Below are details of<br>books available for review in Hospitality & Society, as well as a call for<br>contributions to future issues.<br><br>*1. Books Available for Review*<br><br>We have copies of the following books available for review for the<br>Hospitality & Society Journal:<br><br>*VODKA POLITICS: ALCOHOL, AUTOCRACY, AND THE SECRET HISTORY OF THE RUSSIAN<br>STATE, MARK LAWRENCE SCHRAD (2014)* [...] Thomas Thurnell-Read 2014-06-25T09:51:37+00:00 2014-06-25T09:51:37+00:00 FW: BSA Alcohol Study Group News https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP;833e1bf3.1406 Dear Study Group members,<br><br>Further to this morning\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds email, I have been asked to circulate information relating to a research scholarship post currently advertised by the University of Greenwich on \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdThe role of home drinking in women in the development of problematic drinking\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. Looks like a great opportunity on a fascinating project. [...] Thomas Thurnell-Read 2014-06-25T08:49:10+00:00 2014-06-25T08:49:10+00:00 BSA Alcohol Study Group News https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP;b77183d1.1406 Dear Study Group members,<br><br>Many of you may be interested to know that group member Henry Yeomans (who is Lecturer in Criminology and Criminal Justice at the University of Leeds) has recently published a book called 'Alcohol and Moral Regulation: Public Attitudes, Spirited Measures and Victorian Hangovers'. The book draws together Henry\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds research on alcohol legislation and regulation, temperance and moral panics. More information can be found at http://www.policypress.co.uk/display.asp?ISB=9781447309932&. [...] Thomas Thurnell-Read 2014-04-15T12:05:57+00:00 2014-04-15T12:05:57+00:00 The Alcohol Study Group at the BSA Annual Conference https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP;80c62255.1404 ?Dear Study Group members,<br><br>Many of you may be attending the BSA Annual Conference in Leeds next week and, although we do not have a formal stream representing the group, we have decided to run an informal meet up and discussion on the Thursday lunchtime. The session will run from 12.30-13.30 on Table 15 in the side hall and will be led by Karl Spracklen. The session will give a chance for group members and those with an interest in the work of the group to 'drop by' and have a chat about sociology of alcohol issues over lunch. [...] Thomas Thurnell-Read 2014-04-01T06:05:10+00:00 2014-04-01T06:05:10+00:00 Re: CALL FOR PAPERS: Drinking Dilemmas: Space, Culture and Identity https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-ALCOHOL-STUDY-GROUP;b6c779e7.1404 Dear Alcohol Study Group Members,<br><br>There is still time to submit an abstract for consideration for the planned edited volume Drinking Dilemmas: Space, Identity and Culture in time for the deadline which is this Friday 4th April. Please see the attached call for papers for further details. The initial response has been strong and there have been a number of submissions, many but not all of which are based on papers presented at the conference held at Cardiff Metropolitan University in December. [...]
